question: Which island houses the "Piton des Neiges"?
explanation: The Piton des Neiges, also known as Snow Peak, is 3070 meters high Pliocene aged dormant shield volcano located in the Reunion Island, an overseas region of France in the Indian Ocean. This mountain forms the highest point of the Reunion Island. This volcano was formed as a result of the volcanic activities of the Reunion Hotspot.
